meanings.definition: canvass - to solicit votes or opinions from a group of people
meanings.sent1: The students will canvas their classmates for ideas on the school project.
meanings.sent2: Every election season, politicians canvas neighborhoods to gain support.
meanings.sent3: The canvassers were so persuasive, they even convinced the shyest student to speak up.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to canvas opinions was like a magnet, drawing in diverse viewpoints effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The team's strategy to canvas the community led to valuable insights and strong connections.

meanings.definition: canvasser - a person who solicits votes or opinions from a group of people
meanings.sent1: The dedicated canvasser knocked on every door in the neighborhood to gather opinions.
meanings.sent2: As a canvasser, she had to be friendly and approachable to engage with people effectively.
meanings.sent3: The canvasser's enthusiasm was contagious, making even the grumpiest neighbors smile.
meanings.sent4: She was like a skilled artist, painting a picture of public opinion with each conversation as a canvasser.
meanings.sent5: The young canvasser's passion for democracy shone brightly in every interaction.
